text: Memorial to Wall in Ely Cathedral Eric St Quintin Wall (19 April 1915 – 11 April 2011)http://www.churchtimes.co.uk/content.asp?id=111376 was the second Bishop of Huntingdon from 1972The Times, Thursday, 23 Mar 1972; pg. 19; Issue 58434; col E D-Day chaplains are made bishops suffragan to 1980 and from then on an Assistant Bishop within the Diocese of Gloucester. The son of a clergyman — Sydney Herbert WallWho's Who 2008: London, A & C Black, 2008 —, he was born on 19 April 1915 and educated at Clifton College and Brasenose College, Oxford. Ordained in 1939 he began his ecclesiastical career with a curacy in Boston, Lincolnshire Crockford's Clerical Directory 2008/2009 Lambeth, Church House Publishing after which he was a World War II chaplain in the RAFVR. When peace returned he held incumbencies at Malmesbury, Cricklade List of incumbents and then finally (before his appointment to the episcopate) at Westbury Park, Bristol. ==References== Category:1915 births Category:2011 deaths Category:People educated at Clifton College Category:Alumni of Brasenose College, Oxford Category:Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve personnel of World War II Category:Bishops of Huntingdon Category:Royal Air Force chaplains Category:World War II chaplains
title: Eric Wall
